brief_summary.textblock:
The objective of this study is to evaluate the safety and efficacy of up to 26 weeks of
      treatment with calcitriol 3 mcg/g ointment when used twice daily, without occlusion, to
      treat pediatric subjects (2 to 17 years of age) with mild to moderate plaque psoriasis.

clinical_study.brief_title: Long Term Safety and Efficacy Study of Calcitriol 3 mcg/g Ointment in Pediatric Subjects With Plaque Psoriasis

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Male or female 2 to 17 years of age

          -  Clinical diagnosis of stable mild to moderate plaque psoriasis

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Other forms of psoriasis

          -  Hypercalcemia

          -  Past history of kidney stones

          -  Vitamin D deficiency

          -  Other concomitant dermatological disease

clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter Open Label Uncontrolled Study of the Long Term Safety and Efficacy of Calcitriol 3 mcg/g Ointment Applied Twice Daily for 26 Weeks in Pediatric Subjects (2 to 17 Years of Age) With Mild to Moderate Plaque Psoriasis

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

primary_outcome.description:
Proportion of subjects with serum albumin-adjusted calcium higher than the upper normal limit and/or PTH levels below the lower limit of normal.
Incidence of urolithiasis
primary_outcome.measure: Laboratory parameters related to calcium metabolism after 26 weeks of topical treatment with Calcitriol 3 mcg/g

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.
